name: Conway's Game Of Life (Ghost_Drift)
description:
"The Game of Life is not your typical computer game. It is a cellular automaton, and was invented by Cambridge mathematician John Conway. This game became widely known when it was mentioned in an article published by Scientific American in 1970. It consists of a grid of cells which, based on a few mathematical rules, can live, die or multiply. Depending on the initial conditions, the cells form various patterns throughout the course of the game."  -Playgameoflife.com

This is a version of Conway's game of life for the playdate.

Controls:

A: toggles hilighted cell

B: clear's the screen

D-pad: movement

Turn the crank clockwise to advance the simulation, turn it counter clockwise one full rotation to clear the screen.

The game features two themes a Dark theme and a Light theme. 

Included is a how to play menu option which will explain the gameplay.
